thread.title: Fewer than 2,000 tickets have been sold for Nigeria vs Senegal friendly in London featuring Sadio Mane and Alex Iwobi

author: mirror
title: Fewer than 2,000 tickets have been sold for Nigeria vs Senegal friendly in London featuring Sadio Mane and Alex Iwobi
text:
Sport Fewer than 2,000 tickets have been sold for Nigeria vs Senegal friendly in London featuring Sadio Mane and Alex Iwobi A selection of Premier League stars expected to line up at Barnet stadium The Hive, which has a capacity of more than 6,000 Share Sadio Mane and Alex Iwobi will both be in action at The Hive (Photo: Getty Images Europe) Share Get football updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Fewer than 2,000 tickets have been sold for Thursday's friendly between Nigeria and Senegal in London. 
Arsenal's Alex Iwobi and Liverpool's Sadio Mane are among the Premier League stars expected to line up at Barnet stadium The Hive, which has a capacity of more than 6,000 
Tickets are on sale for as little as £5 for children and £10 for adults but the majority remain unsold. 
As well as Iwobi and Mane, fans who do make the trip will also get the chance to watch Victor Moses, Kelechi Iheanacho, Isaac Success, Ahmed Musa, Idrissa Gueye, Cheikhou Kouyate, Alfred N’Diaye and Mame Biram Diouf. Nigerian players training in London before Thursday's game (Photo: Alex Iwobi / Twitter) Read More Arsenal star Alex Iwobi joins up with Nigeria teammates ahead of international friendlies in London 
Looking ahead to the game, Man City striker Iheanacho said: “Always good to be back with the team, everyone looking sharp and fit this morning." 
Salisu Yusuf's Super Eagles are currently top of their World Cup qualifying group, which also features Cameroon, Zambia and Algeria. 
Senegal, meanwhile, are second bottom in theirs - ahead of the Cape Verde Islands but behind South Africa and Burkina Faso. Like us on Facebook
